annotations.description: On this episode of How to Drink, I’m taking a look at making a Queen’s Park Swizzle. This is a drink invented at the Queen’s Park Hotel in Port au Spain Trin...
annotations.title: Queen's Park Swizzle | How to Drink

annotations.description: The Queen's Park Swizzle was created at The Queen's Park Hotel in Port-Of-Spain, Trinidad in the 1920's. This hotel was the jewel of The Queen's Park Savanna...
annotations.title: Master The Classics: Queen's Park Swizzle

textContent:
2oz (60ml) White Rum
1oz (30ml) Lime Juice
.75oz (20ml) Demerara Syrup
1 Sugar cube
8-10 Mint Leaves
A few dashes Angostura and Peychauds Bitters
Mint Sprig Garnish

Muddle ingredients in glass. 
Add crushed ice. 
Swizzle. 
Top with angostura and/or peychauds.
Garnish with mint. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YMnUboOxII0&t=5s

---
- .5 oz or 14 ml Lime Juice
- .5 oz or 14 ml Demerara Syrup
- 2 Dashes of Angostura Bitters
- 2 oz or 60 ml Blended Black Rum
- Swizzle over Crushed Ice
- Garnish with Sprig of Mint & Grenadine

Muddle 4 mint leaves, demerara, and lime into glass and muddle
Add the rest of the ingredients, crushed ice, and swizzle

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E2ZVDGLpjqI
title: Queen Park Swizzle
